title: What's the point of making an "order" side in VS events?
body:
I'm calling it now remember folks. The more edgy character will win in 99% of all of Riot's future VS events. Does Riot have a solution to this?

Why not make them more neutral in theme or do two of the same theme for an actual chance of the other side winning.

If you want the win rewards, pick the egdy character, plain and simple. It really takes out the fun of the whole vs event idea.

Darius wants eternal war even among his own men. Obey me or Die vs Obey me and Die

Darius is not obey me and die.
He is the absolute opposite of "obey". His vision of the new world to come is that you fight for yourself, ever.

All these people stating that in Darius' world the strong would rule over the weak leave out that this is against the whole philosophy behind Darius. He doesn't want tyrants, he doesn't want rulers, anything like that. 

The whole meaning is that you fight, even if you are weak. So yes, if you are weak, you are most likely going to die against the strong. But at least you **fought**, you didn't just give in and ran to big daddy Garen crying to protect you. You are fighting for yourself, if you lose, so be it, you are dead, but at least you don't become someone's slave.

Or in short:
"Better die standing than living on your knees"

His stance is "I hunger for eternal war and if you aren't fighting for your life then we have a problem"

There is no "strong" class that gets to survive while the weak perish. 

Strong vs strong, weak vs weak....everybody fights and kills until they die, such is the reality of endless war. Darius himself wants to die by his own men.

God King Garen is well aware of mankinds inherent flaw to always be at war with themselves, and believes the only to save you from yourself is with strict rule. His power must be absolute to preserve the order. 

Darius would encourage your destructive impulses and have you revel in what destroys you. You'll never be more then a warring beast anyway, why not just indulge in your decent. 

Who seems like the one more interested in the well being of the people?

The question that needs to be asked to establish a start point. Can you call yourself a human with out free will?   

If you feel yes, you can appreciate what Garren is trying to accomplish.

 Yet if you say no, that  free will defines what makes one human, he is one of the worst tyrants imaginable, one who destroys something that's core to what defines you.

Im the latter, Hence I think Garren is much more of a villain and is a tyrant to be overthrown.

The idea of service to a higher calling or power scares many people, its not a surprise that you think you can only be happy with your illusion of control over yourself. 

That raises the question though, is any child able to be happy in your eyes under the rule of his father? You can be under somethings rule, and find your life is better for it.

Garen is the stern father who is harsh, but has your best interests in mind, Darius is the uncle who lets you drink underage then tosses you the keys to go pick up another pack. I can tell you which one the foolish child will think is the one who lets them be "Free" but it is only the freedom to destroy themselves.

I think eternal war and slaughter of anyone that darius decides to oppose that day for all eternity is much of of a jerk move than garen deciding to smite someone he considered a heathen. Atleast if Garen won there can be some sorta peace and you can overthrow him at some point.
